name: Tiny Galaxy (itch) (matfas)
description:
With Tiny Galaxy you can generate awesome looking galaxies with up to hundreds of thousands of celestial bodies.

There are planets, moons, stars and you might even find the occasional black hole if you look closely.

Controls
- Jump to celestial body: Point and click
- Move around: WASD/Arrow keys or Joystick
- Zoom in/out: Scroll up/down or Page up/down
- Start/stop time: Shift
- Generate new galaxy: Return
- Jump to home planet: Space or Middle click
- Reset galaxy parameters: Backspace
- Toggle full screen: Alt+Return or F4
- Toggle HUD: F5
- Create screenshot: Print or F10
- Toggle debug menu: F9

Tiny Galaxy was created as a submission for the PROCJAM 2019 and was partly inspired by Morgan McGuire's "Tiny Planet" shader: https://www.shadertoy.com/view/lt3XDM

Tiny Galaxy was created in a custom C++ engine using the following libraries:
- Dear ImGui: https://github.com/ocornut/imgui
- stb: https://github.com/nothings/stb
- miniaudio: https://github.com/dr-soft/miniaudio
- GLFW: https://www.glfw.org
- GLM: https://glm.g-truc.net
- Glad: https://glad.dav1d.de
- mcguire.glsl: Morgan McGuire (https://casual-effects.com)

Asset files were used from:
- Sound files: https://freesound.org
- Font files: https://fonts.google.com
